title: Interactive Art Installation
description: An interactive digital art installation that combines algorithmic animation with physical interface controls. This project explores the intersection of art, technology, and user interaction.

images.alt: Completed unit next to example parts

contentBlocks.content: This interactive art installation represents the perfect intersection of my technical skills and creative interests. It combines algorithmic animation with physical interface controls to create an engaging user experience that responds in real-time.
Technical Architecture

content: Backend: Raspberry Pi for hardware control
Interface: Custom physical controls and sensors

content.caption: The completed installation in action, demonstrating real-time user interaction.

contentBlocks.content: The project challenged me to think about user experience from both a software and hardware perspective. Creating intuitive physical controls that seamlessly integrate with digital animations required careful consideration of both domains.

title: Boeing
description: Avionics test automation and requirements management work at Boeing Commercial Airplanes.

contentBlocks.content: Working at Boeing Commercial Airplanes was an incredible opportunity to apply software engineering principles to safety-critical avionics systems. The scale and complexity of aircraft systems provided unique challenges that required both technical expertise and meticulous attention to detail.
Key Achievements

content: Managed 1,250+ system requirements for 777X and 787 aircraft
Reduced testing time by 60% through automation
Led frontend development for internal tools
Ensured compliance with DO-178C safety standards

contentBlocks.content: The work required deep understanding of both software development and aviation safety standards. Every line of code and every test case had to meet the highest standards of reliability and traceability.
Technical Skills Applied

content: Python for test automation and data processing
IBM DOORS and RQM for requirements management
JavaScript and HTML/CSS for internal tool development

title: Makerspace
description: University makerspace management and community building at UWM.

images.alt: Makerspace view of benches and printers
Vinyl sticker cutter and material storage rack

contentBlocks.content: Managing the university makerspace was about more than just maintaining equipment - it was about building a community of makers, learners, and innovators. The space became a hub for creativity and hands-on learning.
Community Impact

content: Organized Proto Club events and activities

content.alt: Makerspace view of benches and printers
content.caption: The main makerspace area with workbenches and 3D printers ready for student projects.

contentBlocks.content: The most rewarding aspect was seeing students grow from complete beginners to confident makers. The space provided a safe environment for experimentation and learning from failure.
Equipment Management

title: Art
description: Digital art and creative coding projects exploring algorithmic and parametric design.

contentBlocks.content: My art projects explore the intersection of mathematics, programming, and visual design. Through algorithmic and parametric approaches, I create pieces that blend the precision of code with the expressiveness of art.
Creative Process

content.caption: A piece exploring visual synthesis and algorithmic composition.

contentBlocks.content: Each piece starts with a mathematical concept or algorithm, which I then translate into visual form. The process often involves iteration and refinement, allowing the code to guide the artistic direction.
Technical Approach

content: Creative coding with various programming languages
Interactive media and user experience design

title: Webservers and Sites
description: Home server setup and web development projects.

images.alt: First home server being set up

contentBlocks.content: My home server setup represents a comprehensive approach to web infrastructure, combining server administration, web development, and security best practices. It's been a great learning environment for understanding full-stack development.
Infrastructure Setup

content.caption: The home server infrastructure supporting multiple web applications and services.

contentBlocks.content: Running my own servers has given me hands-on experience with everything from hardware setup to application deployment. It's taught me the importance of reliability, security, and scalability in web infrastructure.
Web Development Projects

title: DNR
description: Government IT automation and PowerShell scripting for Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources.

contentBlocks.content: Working at the Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources provided an opportunity to apply automation and scripting skills to improve government IT operations. The focus was on creating reliable, efficient solutions that could handle the unique challenges of government infrastructure.
Automation Achievements

content: Optimized PowerShell scripts for IT operations
Saved hundreds of hours in manual processing

content.caption: The workspace where automation scripts were developed and tested for government IT operations.

contentBlocks.content: The work required understanding of both technical automation and government IT policies. Every script had to be robust, well-documented, and compliant with government security standards.
Technical Skills Applied

title: Work at UWM
description: University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee projects and research work.

contentBlocks.content: My work at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee involved a diverse range of academic and technical projects, from research initiatives to educational technology implementation. It was an opportunity to contribute to both the academic community and technological advancement.
Academic Contributions

The university environment provided a unique setting for exploring new technologies and methodologies. Working with students and faculty allowed me to stay current with emerging trends while contributing to meaningful research projects.
Technical Focus Areas

The experience reinforced the importance of clear communication, documentation, and collaboration in technical projects. Working in an academic setting required balancing innovation with reliability and accessibility.

title: TimeAssign Student Project
description: Student project management and scheduling system developed as an academic project.

images.alt: UML diagram views of the system

contentBlocks.content: TimeAssign was a comprehensive student project that combined software engineering principles with practical project management needs. It demonstrated the full software development lifecycle from requirements gathering to implementation.
Project Scope

content: Student project management and scheduling system
UML diagrams and system architecture design

content.alt: UML diagram views of the system
content.caption: Comprehensive UML diagrams showing the system architecture and relationships.

contentBlocks.content: The project followed agile development methodology, allowing for iterative improvement and adaptation to changing requirements. This approach taught valuable lessons about project management and team collaboration.
Development Process
